SourcedStatement: The U.S. Army was making 14,000 artillery shells a month prior to the conflict. Now, officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.
Name: U.S. Army
Justification: Officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.

SourcedStatement: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.
Name: Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.

SourcedStatement: Officials at Tobyhanna estimate that its average annual salary is $30,000 higher than the average salary in northeastern Pennsylvania, which is around $58,000 in 2021.
Name: Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: Officials at Tobyhanna estimate that its average annual salary is $30,000 higher than the average salary in northeastern Pennsylvania, which is around $58,000 in 2021.

SourcedStatement: “We’re all about quality jobs, and that’s a quality organization,”
Name: Bob Durkin
Title: president and chief executive officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce
Justification: Bob Durkin, the president and chief executive officer of the Scranton Chamber of Commerce said.

SourcedStatement: “It’s not $277 million that stays here. But, you know, it’s a good chunk of it,”
Name: Matt Cartwright
Title: Congressman
Justification: Congressman Matt Cartwright, who sits on the House Appropriations Committee and represents Scranton and other parts of Northeastern Pennsylvania pointed to a $277 million Raytheon contract to illustrate this point.

SourcedStatement: “I don’t really think that people dwell or concentrate on anything that’s going on outside of their sphere of influence,”
Name: Rich Hansen
Title: Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant
Justification: Rich Hansen, the Commander’s Representative at the Scranton Army Ammunition Plant, said.

SourcedStatement: “With the Ukraine support, you know, one day I was sitting there thinking about what needs to be done, and it kind of hit me that what we were doing directly affects whether people live or die,”
Name: Jim Jarick
Title: senior technology center engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot
Justification: said Jim Jarick, a senior technology center engineer at the Tobyhanna Army Depot.

SourcedStatement: “At the height of last year’s counteroffensive, the Ukrainians were firing about 6,000 a day, ”
Name: Mark Cancian
Title: senior advisor at the Center for Strategic and International Studies
Justification: Mark Cancian, a senior advisor at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, told Morning Edition that Ukraine receives around 90,000 artillery shells a month, but that’s still not enough to keep up with Russia’s firing power.

SourcedStatement: “Our first task is to save our people,”
Name: Olksandr Popov
Title: commander of a Ukrainian artillery unit
Justification: Col. Olksandr Popov, the commander of a Ukrainian artillery unit, estimates that they need about 30 to 40 shells to take out one Russian target, which is why these artillery shells are at the top of Ukraine’s list of needs.
